review_title: They will not care about you. Run away if you are a PhD student!!
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Newark, NJ
pros: Proximity to NYC Diversity of the students
cons: They pay incredibly low wages for the PhD students. You will hardly rent a room nearby with what they pay you and buy groceries. The pay that they pay definitely is below liveable wage. They refuse to pay for health insurance even though it is in the contract. They will try to take advantage of you in every possible way to squeeze in more money. They will side against you at every chance regarding issues of employment, immigration, and research advisor. You will be working on all major holidays without compensation. If you are an international student, it will be even worse since they know that you do not have many options.

review_title: Okay place to learn and get out!
pros: I liked the place, competitive work environment, got pushed to my limits for sure and was provided support to learn, despite the fact that the support was extremely minimalistic. Still better than nothing. Majority of people who work there are very nice. But be cautious! You will meet absolutely brilliant people which will give you a positive outlook on life.
cons:
Oh I have a lot, for starters:
1- BUREAUCRACY AND DIRTY POLITICS. 
2- BUREAUCRACY AND DIRTY POLITICS. 
3- BUREAUCRACY AND DIRTY POLITICS. 
4- BUREAUCRACY AND DIRTY POLITICS. 
Other things I found as cons are:
Preferential treatment for all who suck up. If you do not kneel and become a pawn, you practically have no way growing and you will eventually, either get laid off (due to re-orgs), or if you served for a long time and the Institution felt a sense of shame and did not want to just dump you, then you will be removed and hired in a pointless position to remain there and strip you of all purpose and/or goals till you retire and leave.
Also, be prepared to have your credit stolen away from you for other higher ups! If you do something spectacular and a director or a higher up just wanted to feel good about themselves. They will, right in front of you make you look like you did nothing and give gratitude to your director instead of you, while you sit there, clap and congratulate someone else for the hard work you did.

review_title: They need to get rid of deadwood middle management
pros: State has excellent benefits. Some people are very good and committed. Depending on your boss, you may have some flexibility in your work-life balance.
cons:
Several key people are extremely negative and are promoted for negative behavior. Focus is on talking a good game not doing their jobs. Can be very frustrating as the worst are protected by tenure or by shmoozing with the higher-ups. Managing up is more important than getting the job done. Examples are some of the awards going to people who don't do their work but "need to be kept" for some reason (which is not work-related).
Opportunity for advancement is minimal unless you know about jobs through the grapevine. No internal job postings, external job posting site is terrible.

cons:
There is no commute. Not having a long commute to and from work can save a great deal of time and money. It can even reduce your daily stress levels.
There is greater flexibility. Working from home allows you to work during your most productive times, wear what you're most comfortable wearing and create a workflow that works for you.
You can reduce distractions. While there may be distractions at home, you control them much easier than you can control distractions that come from coworkers, employees, and other office-based noise.

review_title: Best dead end job in the public sector
pros: Higher education allows interaction with energetic optimistic students. The university had great programs in the sciences. Entire operation ran like a well oiled machine. Each department carried out it's specific part to contribute to the greater mission of the school. The salary schedule was very fair and the benefits are excellent. Free use of the state of the art gym and the campus is beautiful.
cons:
NOT FOR CREATIVE TYPES!!
Creative people stay away unless you want to work in the theater department. One of the most boring places to work is only made worst given the fact that you are constantly surrounded by promising young ambitious students with their whole lives ahead of them. Training is almost non existent in most administrative positions. They expect you to understand not only the university environment, but also government requirements and complicate proprietary database software within the first week before management and coworkers begin to get annoyed. Although there was tremendous opportunity for internal promotion, it is not a place to settle if that industry does not line up with your life goals. Like moving to rooms in aMany of my coworkers had no idea what they were doing but had no problem looking at others cross-eyed when they made mistakes.

cons: there is nothing you can not solve

pros: There was a lot to learn
cons: The payment was very slow

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Newark, NJ
pros: Great experience and exposure with students
cons: No cons so far to my knowledge

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Newark, NJ
pros: Flexible work hours, remote working, most supervisors are nice.
cons: Insufficient pay, incompetent management, some supervisors can be nasty.

pros: It was an on campus job.
cons: None its a starting on campus job

pros: Good state benefits especially the medical insurance and tuition remission
cons: Bad management in enrollment services

pros: Nice pay and nice environment
cons: Not a lot of work

pros: The first semester involves very little work besides learning the material you need to be able to do the research. There is free lunch at every meeting and free food over the summer, and opportunities to travel to conferences. Its also good for your future plans, as the professors you work for will be able to write recommendations etc.
cons: Some of the projects may be over some of the students heads. Since you work with a partner, make sure you know who you are going to be working with. If you haven't had classes with the professors that are directing the projects, then ask around and see which ones would be the best to work for. Also, try to read their research papers before you choose who to work for, because that's probably the type of research you are going to be doing.

pros: Beautiful downtown Newark so great
cons: Management Could care less about anything than padding their pockets

pros: Their lack of oversight means you often have autonomy in your teaching.
cons:
Considering that their full-time faculty have one of the highest salary scales in the country, the adjunct pay is not even on par with other area schools (including Rutgers across the street or Stevens)  - and it has not increased in many years.
If you teach in the evening, most offices and support are closed. 
If you teach online, there is even less support in all these aspects.

review_title: A good stable place to work, but also a highly political and often not collegial.
job_title: Salaried Student Affairs Professional in Newark, NJ
pros: NJIT has great benefits, pays well, and has a strong union for its employees. Many of the employees stay a long time due to the protections and stability that the university affords its employees.
cons: NJIT is a highly political environment and departments can be territorial about their functional areas. The newer leadership can be highly critical and create a divisive atmosphere. Management tends to be very top-down about decisions and the environment is becoming increasingly corporatized.

pros: Great health benefits! Great vacation pay! You have snow days, and many holidays off. Work is standard office work, and is not very difficult.
cons: Everyone is unenthusiastic about working there. Human Resources works for the state, not you. There are so many basic benefits that they don't tell you about that can save you money. Managers are old and outdated in their thinking. You are discouraged to talk to other people in other departments. Women managers are specifically mean to other women at the school. Very disappointing experience! Newark is not a pleasant place to work.

job_title: Assistant Professor in East Brunswick, NJ
pros:
Good dining services.
Excellent library.
Wonderful fitness center.
Well maintained Campus.
cons: Petty and paranoid staff.  Be careful of what you say....there is always someone to make an issue about you having a different point of view.  Working here, you wouldn't believe you are in the United States.  Very unsafe area...Newark remains a very "angry" City. And don't rely on the so called "Digital Education Center" to help you.  Most, if not all the employees in that Department are busy with their own Internet Business on "Company time"  even though they are supposed to be working for the University. Awful and unprofessional losers!

job_title: Erollment Management Area in Newark, NJ
pros:
- Great benefits through the NJ state benefit employee program
- Great vacation/ sick time
cons:
- Salary employees have the short end of the stick. There is no work/ life balance. You are expected to work even at home with no additional compensation
- No HR support
- For a tech institute they lack technology
- High turn over rate 
- They manage through fear.

pros: Great networking opportunities.  Easy to build alliances with other departments.  Above average compensation and great benefits.  Good people to work with.  Very convenient summer hours.  Nice move for Athletics to Division 1 competition
cons: Some of the ethics regulations are ridiculous, made in response to mismanagement at other universities.  Parking can be a challenge.  Not everyone works to the same level of efficiency.  Some faculty need to have retired a long time ago but are still here.

review_title: Time feels like it stands still.
pros: It's easy to commute by public transportation.  The benefits and health insurance are quite good and gym membership is free (but you get what you pay for).
cons: Any paperwork requiring approval from multiple departments is a nightmare: purchasing, travel reimbursmenets, PAF approvals... and if the person who is supposed to do it is sick or on vacation, you just have to wait, no one else will know how to do it.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Newark, NJ
pros: The work I did was rewarding and fun.  The people I worked with were wonderful.
cons: So much false in formation from every department I interacted with.  I had to chase down 3 different people to make sure I got my first paycheck on time (and guess what, I still didn't).  The HR orientation was peppered with false information.  Mistakes were made on my paycheck.  I still have travel reimbursement for work related travel that hasn't been paid back.  The way that the University functions is unacceptable in many ways.

review_title:
In CAPPL lab we cooperate with each other.
Professor Zivras always gives me guidance when necessary.
job_title: Scheduler for Multicore Processor in Newark, NJ
pros: We develop scheduler for multicore processor together. Firstly, we use C language to simulate the scheduling process to ensure the appropriate algorithm. Secondly, I spend a lot of time transferring the algorithm into real application. Last but not least, I write hardware description language for scheduler.
cons: The application is theoretical and far from application. Also, it can't make full use of chip area. And it is independent so that it can't connect with modern applications well.

job_title: Student Lab Assistant in Newark, NJ
pros: Was worth the experience considering that NJIT is one of many universities in New Jersey which utilizes the Bloomberg Terminal. Definitely recommend any student in the school of management to apply there for a unique experience. Bloomberg is used in stock trading a good portion of the time and is a platform worth learning. Any student is allowed to learn Bloomberg at NJIT and is not exclusive to anyone.
cons: More students should know the lab is available for them to use. There weren't that many responsibilities.

review_title: I served as a Mathematics Tutor at CAPE for two years and had a wonderful time with a kind and flexible managing staff.
pros:
The hours are very flexible and its an on-campus job so the commute is no hassle
The administration is willing to help whenever you need it
You have the opportunity to impact students each and every day
cons:
It is a campus job, so the pay isn't great
You have a wide range of students, some may not be the most respectful

job_title: Web Developer and Office Assistance in Newark, NJ
pros:
If you like slow pace work, this is the best place for you, and if you like to stay where you are.
Different department of school itself have competition to hire good student but not to pay good pay.
cons: Please pay to student employees as per their skills and their responsibilities. Give them opportunity to grow and use their skills.

job_title: Associate Dean for Academic Affairs in Newark, NJ
pros: Innovative, engaged with the community, agent of social and economic mobility. Narrowly focused on STEM education and does it well.
cons: Requires all the energy you can muster to keep pace with the transformations constantly at work.  This is not unique to NJIT.

review_title: Do you fit the Good ol' boys network?
pros: Very interesting variety of students to work with.  Some wonderful faculty.  Easy commuting location.
cons: No salary parity across schools, either for adjuncts or full-time faculty.  Admin is very much an ol' boys network without a sense of democratic,inclusive principles or progressive ideas.

review_title: It was worth my time working there. Good place to work.
pros: Leading Technical university in New Jersey. They have good culture and work environment. You would definitely get good co-workers to work with.
cons: Technology university doesn't spend money on improving technology. Too many departments depend on each other and each department has few members to do the required job.

review_title: I worked in EOP department and as math tutor for summer classes. The work itself is fine.
pros: You get to engage with younger students and have a chance to speak to a bigger group of people. This boosts self confidence.
cons: The training is very random. You have to show up every other week just to listen to the coordinators telling you how you shoud teach.

pros: A state job, which the students are great to interact with. The medical benefits are great. In the summer you receive a 3 day weekend.
cons: The staffing is unorganized and unprofessional. Co- workers are non trustworthy and unethical. There is no vision insurance. Also if you are union it doesn't help.

review_title: Phd student - Worked as a research assistant and teaching asistant
pros: Stipend as an RA or TA is sufficient if you're sharing a room with someone else. Networking is key early on in your phd program to find tutoring or other on-campus opportunities.
cons: If there are budget cuts, summer funding might not be sufficient to pay rent/bills.

pros: Getting to learn a lot right from business system analysis to how the process actually gets implemented in the real world scenario
cons: Did not face any cons of working at this place, It has a lot to offer to the students and will always be a learning ground for all the students.

review_title: Good tutoring for EOP incoming freshmen
pros: Taking the pre-test on the math skill level will sort you into the educational departments of student-separated aptitude. If you are very talented, you will teach smart students.
cons: Some of the struggling students may be difficult if you do not perform outstanding on the aptitude test. Also, the smarter students will expect you to be able to sufficiently help them, so please perform appropriately.

pros: Learned a ton, worked hard, great and kind people to work with. Would definitely recommend for any student looking for research.
cons: University research isn't as high paced as industry and so sometimes it can be slow paced. But nonetheless, great working experience.

review_title: A pleasant experience working with the Math department (student employee).
pros:
Located in a very diverse area you will meet many interesting people.
Not much pressure on the job, schedules were flexible to allow student employees time to study for exams. Decent pay too!
cons: Off-campus (and even on-campus!) can be dangerous at times, it is still Newark after all. I have often received email alerts about someone getting robbed.

pros: I had the opportunity to work closely with a professor as a paid undergraduate research assistant and see what Computer Science research work is like for professors and PhD students alike.
cons: The negative to my experience was working on a project that wasn't widely used by consumers. However, I think this is probably the nature of a lot of research work.

review_title: Great place to work while attending NJIT"
job_title: Senior ECE Webcaster in Newark, NJ
pros: Supervisor always made sure we had the tools we needed to complete the job. Was able to work from home when applicable. Supervisor understood that classes, exams, and projects came first. Online time entry was easy to use and offered staff services available online like pay stubs.
cons: traveling to and parking on campus can be annoying at times.

pros: NJIT is a great public university to work for and attend.  The campus is going through a revitalization and a rejuvenation, from adding new degree programs to building infrastructure to increasing the number of accepted students.
cons: Classrooms need to be updated and expanded.  Some students have to borrow chairs from other classes and some have to stand as they are overcrowded.

review_title: Data analysts building analytical reporting procedures from scratch and help leaders with easy access to reports.
pros: Very friendly environment. Manager and Director always appreciated new ways of doing things. Moreover, personal space was never compromised while working.
cons: Less time allocated for working on new ideas.

job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Newark, NJ
pros: flexible working schedule. Good benefit. Long vacation time. simple relationship. During the summer we need to only work 4 days a week which is a luxury thing.
cons: not much. very strait forward career future. You know clearly where you are going to end. Salary is on the lower end compared with other industry but benefit is on the better end.

pros: I was a Masters Student at NJIT. At NJIT, you have freedom to choose your own courses and study accordingly. It was immense pleasure to be here.
cons: The management is not up to the mark. The advisers sometimes loose track of their students status and their by creating confusion and conflict. Apart from that everything is great.

review_title: Very specialized reference and bibliographical experience
job_title: Reference Librarian Or Library Administrator in Garden City, NY
pros: The job was challenging, and I learned something new everyday about every aspect of working with computers and databases.
cons: Too many nights commuting fron Newartkto Valley Stream, NY

review_title: Mediocre education, A lesson in bureaucracy
pros: Only Bachelors of Architecture in NJ, very strong engineering and math, still developing as a university.
cons: Getting expensive, lots of red tape and hoops to jump through to get the classes you need

pros: Really laid back, and great environment. Very nice people. Help is there if you need it when working on a project or assignment.
cons: A lot of the work falls on you with little guidance. If guidance is needed on a project there are always people to help. Not really many cons. Great place!

pros: A lot of flexibility for students. Easy to do without any surprises most of the time. you can use your laptop during graveyard shifts and prepare for tests or finish an assignment
cons: pay can be a little higher. unnecessary training every semester. we learn from experience and learn nothing in the training.

review_title: Great staff, flexible hours, and comfortable environment.
pros: You get to work in a comfortable environment with flexible hours which you set.
cons: The campus is very small and much of the technology is outdated despite it being a "technical" university.

pros: You have free time to plan your life. There are not strict requirements in courses. Near New York City and it's not hard to get a  IT job.
cons: Classes are not very interesting. Newark is not a very safe city.

review_title: Excellent part-time job for a STEM student. Provides a real-world work environment.
pros:
- Great learning community of most STEM fields
- Flexible schedules that work between classes and club meeting times
- Great for expanding your interest in applying theoretical knowledge to various projects, both academic and personal
cons: None, its awesome working there.

pros: Good benefits and a very comfortable atmosphere.  Great people to work with but must be willing to work hard to achieve the goals of the University.  Chance for growth and advancement.
cons: Don't know of any.  Enjoyed working there.

pros: Interaction with youth. Great Management System. Dedicated supervisors and coordinators to urban youth.
cons: Seasonal Employment. Left because I felt I needed a higher paying job in my later 20s.

review_title: You would be looking forward to move on
pros: It is close to the New York City. Opportunities in the industry for the finishing grad students. Indoor tennis courts.
cons: Bad location - Newark. Quality of the students. Poor culture. A lot of politics at the departments. Poor motivation. Poor connections.

pros:
Great working environment
Great people
Friendly people

Everybody is extremely helpful
cons:

No pay during holidays if a part-time employee

pros: Easy going atmosphere and surrounded by brilliant people.
cons: Poor organizational management structure and unsophisticated HR operations.

review_title: Really poor management from the new Dean of Computer Science
pros: Fun to teach gaming and Android platform.
cons: Management had me listed to teach the wrong course up until a week before my class started. I tried contacting them every week for months with no success.

pros: Great place to learn and gain experience while studying on campus
cons: Not so much room to grow as some people don't want competition for their spot so they don't promote so often

pros: Very less work, just to sit and watch if all stations and printers are working well.Not that much technical work to do.
cons: Limited hours to work.Sometimes it gets boring.there is nothing to learn for future.just a part time.

pros: Best on-campus job opportunity for International Students as well as Regular Student. More focuses on Customer Satisfaction.

pros:

cons: City of Newark, Parking hard to find on certain days.

pros: I enjoyed the culture of the company, one that strives for the advancement of higher education.

pros: The professor is good and productive at this field. People are nice. In general, it is a open place for research
